Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy P
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights here and will definitely stay here again. The staff were very helpful, and went out of their way to help us (we booked an extra room at the last minute and asked for this to be close to the other room we had booked, and if possible with a bath for my little one, and they sorted things really well for us). The breakfast was great (and in a lovely airy bright room on the roof). The rooms were compact, but well equipped, though would have liked tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth S
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from two nights in this delightful modern hotel with my daughter and 19-month old granddaughter and I must say I'm at a loss to understand the previous reviewer's experience. Yes, the rooms are a bit small but they have everything one needs and are clean. As for the staff, we found them extremely helpful and courteous in every way. We had requested two rooms as close to each other as possible and they bent over backwards to accommodate us. Nothing was too much trouble. I will definitely return and will be recommending this to any friend or family who wishes to visit Rome. Although not central, it is a few minutes from the Metropolitana Re di Roma which takes you to the centre in minutes and you don't pay the prices of hotels in the centre! It is also in a relatively quiet location. An excellent find.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star, no customer service, ants in the bath and toilet that did not work!!”
Reviews.Author: brothers4G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just before Christmas with my husband, hoping for a nice 2 days in Rome before heading to see his family. The first night, we had a suite with a tub, and I was so looking forward to a relaxing bath. However, what we found was that a group of ants had taken over the tub and everything around it! So, at midnight, after 3 calls and 2 trips to the front desk, they finally changed our room. In this room, no tub, and very small (not even room for 2 suitcases) for the same price. This room had a problem with the toilet. The water never stopped running in it after flushing...we were afraid it would flood the room. Again, a call and trip to the front desk where we were told that no one was available to fix it until "later" (this was 6 am). We left for the day and when we returned, we were told it was fixed, but after 2 times, the problem returned. We were never so happy to leave a hotel! When we asked if we could please be compensated somehow for our problems with the room; we were told that we would still have to pay the full price for the stay...INCREDIBLE!! NOT a FOUR STAR, do not stay in this hotel. The service is poor, irresponsible and indifferent, even for Italians!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful find”
Reviews.Author: Nicky C
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at this lovely hotel whilst on a short break to celebrate my husband's birthday. It is in an excellent location- near to both the train station, and within walking distance of some of the best sites Rome has to offer. The decor is modern, with some brilliant artwork on display, and spotlessly clean throughout. Our room was spacious, with welcome air-conditioning ( temperatures during the day were in the thirties), and a glorious wet-room- much appreciated after many hours out seeing the sights. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly- when we asked for recommendations for somewhere to eat, they directed us to a delightful, local family restaurant which we liked so much that we went back the following night. The Continental breakfast each morning was fresh and tasty, with more than enough variety to choose from. Next to the breakfast room there is a pretty little terraced area where we used to take a glass of wine in the evening, and just chill out listening to the sounds of the city around us, and watching the planes fly in to the airport. Very romantic!! The local area felt extremely safe, and there is a good selection of shops to browse around within a five minute walk. We really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend this hotel to all our family and friends- we would definitely stay there again if we should ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinPie1984
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Easy access to Tuscolana train station, to travel to airport, or Metro Re di Roma, to travel to main train station. Staff very friendly and helpful. But...the room is a little small. It's decent and clean but I personally wouldn't rate the room for 4 star. It would be something between 3 and 4. Breakfast choices were poor. I guess this place is okay but I would try search some more next time I'm back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Simple”
Reviews.Author: KarlaDL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit far from the central areas in Rome. It was a 30 minute Speed walk from the hotel to the Collesium. But wonderful area with plenty of shops and places to eat in the area. Plus there are a few subway stops right around the corner and you can be to many places within 5 to 10 minutes. I am a pretty light sleeper and did well during my stay here. The beds were ok but the comforters were very fluffy. They were doing a lot of renavating during mine and my friends stay so there was a lot of construction equipment around and people working. Not all areas were open. But it served our purpose of a nice, safe place to rest at the end of a long day. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Paskwal
Reviews.Content: Clean modern close! Some amazing friendly staff, great breakfast not poor at all like some said!! Overall according to hotels in Rome I think it's great for it's price looks and what It offers!

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaterinaLimoura
Reviews.Content: Although another room was available, the first night they let as sleep in a room with obvious dump on the wall above our heads and so smelly we had to keep the window open all night!! The cleaning lady (very polite and helpful) told us that the room has always been that terrible and that they can't fix it. The man at the reception said that a small problem could have occurred and that they’ll fix it soon!! On the second night they gave us a really nice room (TV not working though) but sometime at night (9 o'clock) another resident enter into with a door key and with his luggage on hand! That guy at the reception told us that that could be the man to fix the TV!! However the breakfast was good and it is a beautiful hotel but not at all money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Execellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: glad2bhereca
Reviews.Content: Clean - modern - quiet with everything you need in a hotel. Unfortunately the rooms are very small - it’s almost got a cruise ship like layout (imagine a suite on a cruise ship). Very high ceilings so that helps. The furnishings and toilet are very upscale modern clean lines so its really cool looking hotel but again the rooms are small. Breakfast was good and covered all the basics to ensure there is something for everyone. Great bread - cold meats - eggs - croissants and cake - cereals - jams - juices and coffee. Its basic though not high end hotel selection. The breakfast area is on the 3rd floor and it’s a really nice set up. The area has glass enclosure all around that gives it’s a nice atmosphere in the morning. You have access to large patio to either eat outside or enjoy your coffee. Its located on 3rd floor so its bright and full of fresh air with access to the outdoor patio. The location of the hotel for being outside of the center of Rome is the biggest plus for this hotel when you factor two things - cost and being in a local neighbourhood that provides a glimpse into the everyday life of Romans. Being outside of the center you really feel like you are the only tourist walking around (which is really cool) You can take advantage of the pricing for restaurants - shopping and general items you would purchase - access to Pharmcy - foodmarket etc. Obviously being in the center of Rome would be more convenient from access to sites and Piazza but you pay dearly for it. This hotel is a 5 min walk to Di Roma Metro station. The cost for a three day pass is approx 15EUR. This metro stop is 3 stops to the main Terminal which is a main point to get to the subway line to the Coliseum or continue on this line 3-5 stops for other major attractions like the Spanish Steps and Fountain Trevi. It addition to the Metro pass you have access to all the buses which is a big plus getting around the centre of Rome. The center of Rome is huge and even though its great to walk its benefical and cost effective to have access to the enourmous amount of buses to just hop on on hop off to get off your feet and get accross town quickly to the other major sites. The walk to the Metro and to the Piazza of Di Roma (think of it as the downtown section to the neighbourhood you are staying in - lots of shopping and restaurants - just a great atmosphere when you are not sightseeing. Again nice neighbourhood and you feel safe walking at all hours but as any big city you need to be careful and use common sense but during the day and early evening there are too many people around to encounter issues. Late at night it gets very quiet - shops are closed (around 8pm other then some restaurants). We walked late at night from one of the Metros because it closed down at 9 pm and it took 20 mins to walk from the center of Rome perimeter to our hotel. In closing if you are looking to reduce your costs and don't mind walking from the hotel to the metro or to the train station (different transportation to get to the airport - about a 10 min walk to the Tuscola station) then I highly recommend this place. The staff was friendly - helpful but their English is not good. Get a map - metro pass and you will be in good hands. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the four stars”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguest055
Reviews.Content: A good location in regard to public transportation and a minimalistic design that does its best to confirm all prejudices concerning modern interior architecture: i.e. appearance first, function last. Small room (be careful not to tear down the TV with your shoulder when you pass between the beautiful sculptured wall and the bed; shower with no door or screen; wc with transparent, plastic, untight sliding shutters and a vent-fan that sounds like a small aeroplane; washbasin with a shelf the size of a hardcover book for all the toilet articles of 2 persons (your wife would love it, along with the single alogen spot light directly overhead that turns her face into a zombie's at make-up time). More: wardrobe with no shelves, the capacity of a standard gym locker (in a double rum); noisy aircond blowing directly on the bed (small room, remeber); window opening at the level of the neighbour's courtyard (dare to leave it open?) and only a few meters from its wall. Want more? OK: indifferent breakfast with industrial bread briquets (in a city gifted with marvelous bread); orange juice to be enjoyed in flimsy plastic airplane-style mugs and a queue to the Nescafe machine (in a 4 stars hotel). The imposing espresso bar machine is off, too much work. To this can be added that the hotel is placed wall-to-wall with a fire station, and on the fast route to one of Rome's largest Hospitals, which is likely to entertain you at all hours, day and night. Still, if ambitious modern design is your dream, this is a good place for you, as you can always relax on the very fine terrace and share the small jacuzzi bathtub on the roof with your fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel but it is Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Reggy_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights at the start of May. The room was tiny, the breakfast was very average and the staff weren't very attentive. However I had read that this is often the case with Roman hotels, for us it was overpriced. And unless you get a really good price, I wouldn't recommend it. The location was 2km from the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, quiet place located close to metro and trains.”
Reviews.Author: MeowVictoria
Reviews.Content: This was an exceptional find for the money. It was very sleek, quiet and perfectly located to go to downtown Rome on Metro, or to go to the airport for 8E on the train. The breakfast selection was amazing, and so nicely served in a lovely area. Hottub on the roof, and the seating there, provided a lovely place to rest after a long day of sight seeing. This haven really made my week long stay in Rome a very happy, happy time. And, the bathroom was very modern and spa like.

Reviews.Title: “Room”
Reviews.Author: doug-jo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay. I agree the rooms are very small but unlike the previous review I have to say that ours was also very clean. Breakfast was fine. Plenty of choice for continental breakfast. Room and crockery etc.clean and coffee machine looked new . Also agree staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely little place!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverleeds
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Cinemusic hotel for my birthday 7-11 October 2010. The hotel is very easy to find using the instructions from the hotel website. I took the time to look on Google Streetmap to locate the hotel so I had a better idea of where to go. Check in was a breeze and the guy who checked us in was very helpful. He provided us with a map and circled all the sights together with drawing the bus routes on there so we knew which one to take, where to get on and off and the route it followed. Our room (215) was very cosy! We had been given a disabled room so the bathroom was huge but the bedroom area was very small. We had one single wardrobe and no drawer space but we managed just fine. We found the bed to be very comfortable and slept well all nights. The aircon was also very good. The room was beautifully decorated and impeccably clean. Toiletries were provided and there were never any issues with a lack of hot water. It was constant and very hot! The breakfast was plentiful and we enjoyed it. There were cereals, ham, salami, cheese, croissants, bread rolls, yogurts, cakes, toast, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs and bacon/sausage mixture. There was also a coffee machine, 2 different flavours of juice, water and milk. On our first afternoon we walked to the Colloseum which is around 2km and took around 45mins (we did take a wrong turn though so had to backtrack!) If you don’t want to walk you can take the tube which is about a 5min walk from the hotel or you can take the number 85 bus from the station which is also around a 5min walk from the hotel. We found the buses to be very reliable, although sometimes a little bit on the full side! You can buy tickets for the bus and the train at newsagents in the stations or on the bus. Remember to validate your ticket on the bus when you board. Although the area surrounding the hotel is not the nicest looking, we never felt unsafe – even late at night. I found that being on the outskirts gave a true reflection of Italian life. We found a lovely restaurant called La Allegra (The Happy Sheep). The food here was absolutely AMAZING and we ate here every night of our break. Being outside of the city centre means the quality of food is better and the prices cheaper. We were having either a pizza or a pasta dish each and at least a litre of wine and the bill was never over 30euros – that includes the 10% service charge and our additional tip (a steal at the side of 15euros for 2 beers on a side street a few minutes walk from the Colloseum!) The pasta at this place is the most amazing I have ever ever tasted!! It was fantastic. The menu is all in Italian but we managed and there is one of the waiters who speaks very good English and will happily help you out. There is a little supermarket on the street at the back of the hotel. We used to pick up a bottle of wine and drink it on the terrace at the hotel. We did ask before we did this and the receptionist was shocked that we’d even asked – ‘this is your hotel – treat it as your home’ was the response we got. How lovely! All in all this is a lovely hotel and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we had expected”
Reviews.Author: Strawsels
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive sides of this hotel : - The location of the hotel is good, it's near a trainstation and a metrostation (if you come from the Leonardo DaVinci airport, don't take the expensive Leonardo-express, but take the other train and get of at Tuscolana. Much faster and cheaper, the hotel is a 5min walk away) - The staff is friendly and helpfull. And I mean everyone on the staff: front dest, maids, breakfastpeople, ... But there are more negative sides : - The rooms are tiny and really dirty. The was blood on the curtains, the matrass (you could even see these stains through the sheets!) , the wall behind the bed. Stains practically everywhere.. (Not just in one room, we swiched rooms after the first night and they were both dirty) - The beds are not comfy at all. - The windows were very dirty. - The breakfast was acceptable, but not for a 4-star hotel. - The internet only worked half of the time. - We stayed for five nights (one night in one room and four in an other) and we didn't once get fresh sheets. - When you open the windows (and we had too, because the airco didn't work so it was hot in the room) there is a lot of noise. I also selected this hotel based on reviews, but I can't see why people were so positive about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiemGr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 3 days in late August, and chose CMH based on the reviews here. I think the reviews are right on target. The hotel is a 4-star in every way but the room size. The rooms are tiny! But that is the only negative there is. The hotel is super clean, nicely decorated and with a lot of ammenities. The staff was really helpful and provided us with maps and directions. The breakfast room is on the 3rd floor and the breakfast itself was very good, a great reason to get out of bed in the morning! Try the gelatto at the piazza near the hotel and if you can afford it and want a gourmet experience dine at Glass Hosteria - there were a few dishes that were truly memorable. And prepare for a lot of walking! Overall I would say that CMH is a very good hotel, especially for the price we payed and there is a solid chance that I would stay there again if I ever returned.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city break to Roma Roma Roma”
Reviews.Author: bilbobaggins66
Reviews.Content: We wanted to coem to Rome and trawled differnt websites and reviews trying to find a hotel that had good reviews, and that we could travel into the cntre of Rome easily enough! Hotel Cinemusic was absolutely perfect...we opted for the deluxe room which we were delighted with, we had a fantastic round bed, modern clean shower (very good and powerful), a terrace to sit out on, the hotel was a deligt to walk around with everything thought of, none of the fixtures and fittings seemed like an afterthught...contrary to the reviews on here the breakfast was amazing, everything you could want to fill you up for a days walking around the beautiful city! I cannot recommend his hotel enough.......from start to finish it was perfect! Easy access to Re Di Roma subway which gets you to the trevi fountain in 10 minutes! we paid 11 euros for a train pass which lasted three days and was a must have for any City break to Rome.....the city needs exploring and the Cinemusic is a perfect way to start and end any day!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, badly made!”
Reviews.Author: pandafyed
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop on our trip through Europe. The hotel is a little bit out of central Rome, so you get to see Italians more than tourists when walking around here! There is a great roundabout up the road at the Re di Roma station up the road with tons of food as well as a decent supermarket to stock up! The Metro train station can get you in to the city of Rome no problem, and tickets are quite cheap. The trains come very often as well, so there's no worry about times to get into the city! Our room was on the first floor, and looked out to... a fire station!!! You'd think it would be horrible, but we never heard a peep from them! The hotel looks very good, but is very shoddily made... The trimming was falling apart, the ceiling in our room had dirt all over it, the shower was mouldy... It is a good deal for money, but don't come to this hotel if you're looking for perfection! The staff were generally good, but we did have a few who looked at us like idiots every time we spoke to them. I would stay there again, but only for the money value!! Oh, and the delicious breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “cine-music to my ears”
Reviews.Author: rachelmcdonnell
Reviews.Content: This was the first of 6 hotels we stayed in over our 2 week stay in Italy and by farrrrrrr this was definately our favourite ! the staff tried there hardest to make our stay welcoming and helped us out with anything we had trouble to find etc . The rooms were modern and clean with free wireless interent which u dont come across often . The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the re di roma train line which is great as it takes u directly to all the main attractions . The breakfast was a great way to start the day , offering hot food and cold . Id definately recomend this hotel and will return when i visit italy next :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money away from the tourist hoardes”
Reviews.Author: ZewLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was on the small side with not much storage space but we were only there a few days so just kept everything in my suit case. We had access to a spacious outdoor terrace which was nice to catch a bit of sun. The only downside to the room was that there was no door on the shower and the loo door did not shut entirely so not much privacy but we managed! Overall however, the decor was fine, the room was clean and it was suitably quiet for a good night's kip after a hard day's sight seeing. The best feature is the roof terrace where they serve a decent buffet breakfast. Another great asset has to be the reception staff who were very helpful providing advice from bus times to museum opening times and markets, happy to look anything up for us if they didn't know straight away and spoke good English. I would also advise, if you're a non-smoker, to make sure to request a non-smokng room, away from any smoking rooms. I woke up on the last night because someone was smoking next door and the smell wafted through. The hotel area is ok. Unfortunately there is a lot of graffiti everywhere but that seems quite common! Didn't spot many bars or restaurants, it's mostly a residential area, but we managed to find a nice restaurant called La Violetta nearby for a first evening which was very popualr with the locals. It also has good transport links, the metro is about 10 minutes walk away and the bus, 5 minutes walk away where the number 82 takes you straight into the centre of Rome in about 10-15 minutes. There is also an overground station about 10 minutes walk which takes you to the airport and is one stop away from the night life in Travestere. We purchased a Roma Pass at the airport station for 20 Euros, its like a 3 day travel card with discounts on certain museum entries (didn't incldue the Vatican though which is a must do if you're a museum boffin). However, we didn't use it enough to get our value for money as we mostly walked everywhere (best way to see Rome) using the bus and metro occasionly to get in and out of town, which is very cheap anyway, (bus -1Euro per trip, Metro - 1.50).

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: LadyStou
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but very modern, clean and neat. The location was perfect, near bus, metro and train, all 500 meters away and very quite place, we didn't have any problems sleeping at night. The service was excellent, everything we asked we had it with no complaints. The breakfast was excellent, every morning it had a buffet with lots of goodies. The hotel wasn't expensive at all. I totally recomend it and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “your choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WendyDub
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations as I entered the very small reception area, but when you enter the room you realise you made a good choice, if you wanna be far from the tourists and experience real roman life then stay here as the San Giovanni area is beautiful and not crammed with people taking pics, just across the block from the hotel is San Giovanni in Laterano Basilica that is breathtaking during the day and even more so at night, also close by is the famous pompi bar where they claim they have the best tiramisu and the locals from all over rome come and get their piece, the hotel is 4 metro steps from the spanish steps and is nice and clean, breakfast at the rooftop is also refreshing although the service isn't top notch, all in all if you want an authentic roman experience then stay at this hotel and go walking and explore the area

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this place!”
Reviews.Author: paw0105
Reviews.Content: Cancellation policy is a scam. While the hotel suggests that they offer a 48 hour cancellation policy they would not honor it for me with a three weeks notice. Do not believe it. Yikes...now I am suck staying at this place in a couple of weeks! Others have posted about an arrogant attitude at this hotel...I'm experiencing it and I haven't even checked in yet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Design, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: EtihadEurope
Reviews.Content: I was there only one night. I was so lucky that I sleept in the suite for the price of a standard room (because there was no other free room), and it was simply amazing. The jacuzzi-tub in the living room, the nice decoration, the automatic air-condititon, and the great breakfast. Best Hotel in Rome, and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staying at the cinemusic”
Reviews.Author: joaninha_braga
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the cinemusic for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Staff was very friendly, room was confortable, modern and clean. Nice breakfast room and jacuzzi lounge at the top floor. Breakfast was kind of poor, but ok. Location was handy for trains at tusculana station and metro at re di roma. There's also a bus station nearby for the route 85 that goes to the center (colosseo, piazza venezia, via del corso).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zorz-gr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really new, it has a very modern design, is very clean, the breakfast is fantastic, they serve a very good capucino, great service from the staff and the reception is very helpfull. The location is ok, not really something to see around there but its about 200m (3min. walk) to the metro station and the center of rome its only 2 or 3 stops away. You also have a free wired internet connection in your room and a lcd tv. The aircondition was working good to. The only negative thing is that the room is a bit small but it wasnt so important for me since the bathroom was spacious. A great stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: PeterVankman
Reviews.Content: Quiet and clean hotel. Staff speak english 24h concierge Room a bit small A bit far from the centro storico

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and badly managed”
Reviews.Author: sabinki
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel and that was enough to make us never come back. The staff is arrogant and obnoxious. The rooms are small. When we stayed there, there was no hot water in the whole hotel for the whole day, which is unacceptable for a 4* hotel. The lift was also broken, about which the staff could not have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Verona29
Reviews.Content: I really need to agree with previous reviews: the only (not so) negative element I could find about the Cinemusic hotel is the size of our room. The rest is absolutely lovely. We booked a superior room, so we expected "more" space, but we got a rather small room compared to other 4star hotels we stayed at. We had small bags becasue we only stayed 3 nights on a romantic weekend, but with bigger suticases it would have been impossible to move inside the room :-) Bed is really confortable, nice balcony, great shower, clean room, nice breakfast, flat screen TV (channels in Italian only ), good location not far from the underground and the center, friendly staff and not too expensive compared to other hotels in Rome! One day, coming out of our room, the maids were cleaning the rooms in our same alley and we saw one bigger room (comapred to the one we had) and a smaller room (even smaller than our room!!!) so I think it is a question of luck...

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Juno72
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay in this hotel with our 22 month old (very active son) and parents in law. We have stayed in Rome before and have always found it hard to get a decent, fairly central and not too expensive hotel. While this hotel is not at the centre of things, it is very well connected by bus and metro to all the major sights, the Colesseum and Piazzo del Spagna being only three or four stops away by metro. Our first impression was of a small but very clean, modern hotel set in a period building. The neighbourhood was quiet. . The room was fairly small but not as small as some Italian hotels we have stayed in and the space was very well designed and utilised. The staff here are what makes the hotel so good - they were really friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable, efficient and helpful. While the bar didn't seem to be in use, this wasn't a problem for us but may be for others. We ate in the pizzeria down the street the first night and it was perfect for us after getting off a lateish flight. The hotel is located near to the San Giovanni area which is well worth a stroll to. It is a very picturesque part of town and there was a market taking place the day we walked there which was a Thursday. Also, for anyone with kids, there is a very nice and safe playground near the hotel with some very friendly Roman children to play with. All in all, we had an excellent stay at this hotel - it was surprisingly good for what we had experienced in the past. Well done to the owners for employing such great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aninha_Richard
Reviews.Content: Me and my love stayed at Cinemusic and we also love everything on this hotel. When we arrived we notice that the room isn`t big, so we ask for another one and the recepcionist show us a bigger room. He and all the others in the Cinemusic were very nice with us. Always with a smile in there faces. The breakfast is realy good and the cleanest is great to. I indicate this hotel to everyone. Also there is a great tratoria next the hotel with the BEST pizza of the world!! Thank you Cinemusic.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: CarmenH1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were keen to stay at this hotel having looked at their website. We stayed in Rome for three nights on a two-week tour around Italy. The cinemusic hotel was the most disappointing. The rooms were very small and were meant to be sound proofed - they weren't we could hear noises in the corridor and in the street. There was very little room to hang up our clothes in the wardrobe. The bar was not in operation - when we asked about it we were told there wasn't any personnel. There was supposed to be a jacuzzi on the roof terrace and after a long hot day walking around Rome it would have been very welcome - but we were told they needed to clean it out and they didn't have the time. My partner wanted to change some traveller checks and was told he couldn't. I found the staff vert rude and unhelpful compared to the other hotels we stayed in during our Italian tour. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “stylish CineMusic”
Reviews.Author: kreni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at CineMusic for two nights on our way from Zagreb to Sicily. Apart from the fact that the hotel is located in one of the most fantastic cities I've ever been to, the hotel itself is great. The staff are wonderful, they parked the car in an underground car park for us, which was very useful after 11 hours of driving from Zagreb. They advised us on where to eat in Rome, how to get to different places... The hotel is tucked away in a nice residential area and it's close to metro station from which you can get to the city centre in 10 minutes. CineMusic is modern, clean, quiet and it offers great breakfast. When I go back to Rome, I will most definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: auldreekie044
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights in June 2008 with my now fiance as we got engaged whilst in Rome. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable and well presented. The manually controlled air conditioning was very welcome and made a real difference, especially in the soaring temperatures. Staff were very helpful and efficient. Breakfast on the sun terrace was a great start to each day and each time was well prepared and plentiful. The nearest underground stop (Ri Di Roma) was only 5 minutes walk away and could take you anywhere you wanted to go in the city, extremely convenient. I could say a lot more about this hotel but to sum up, a very nice, clean and reasonably priced hotel which I would definately return to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne_pl
Reviews.Content: very nice new hotel in a quiet area, not too spacious, very clean and fragrant, for those who don't like big monumental places but with climate and charater, restaurant on the roof, much to choose for brekfest, dirtect conetion to Fiumicno from Stacione Tuscolana (5min.), just near the Metro station Re di Roma, next time in Rome I'll choose CineMusic for sure, just perfect

HotelInfo.Name: CineMusic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Tuscolana 128, 00182 Rome, Italy
